instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, strange voltages on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, strange voltages on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>
threads.message:
What about pin 13/<CHIP>U7200</CHIP>?

Just in case, check diode mode to ground on VREG3/5 outputs and L7220/60.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, strange voltages on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>
threads.message:
Thank you for ypur reply.

Please find below the info requested.


V en0 (pin 13) is14mV;

In diode mode,
VReg3 = 0
VReg5 = 0
L7220 (pin 1 and 2) = 0.60V.

What do you mean by L7220/60, exactly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, strange voltages on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>
threads.message:
"VReg3 = 0
VReg5 = 0"
Do you really have both shorted to ground?
You may want to say OL, but I'm not sure.
However, in diode mode (red probe connected to ground), you cannot get 0 (zero) reading there, nor OL.

"L7220/60"
L7220 AND L7260...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, strange voltages on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>
threads.message:
Yes, sorry, my bad.

I meant,
In diode mode,
VReg3 = 0L
VReg5 = 0L.

Also, in diode mode L7220 is 0.601 and L7260 is 0.449, both measured to ground.

Also, I have to mension that cap <CAPACITOR>C7280</CAPACITOR> is missing, but the pads/ traces around it position look ok.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, strange voltages on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>
threads.message:
Should be good to replace <CAPACITOR>C7280</CAPACITOR>.

You must get some indication on VReg3/5, if you measure diode mode with red probe connected to ground.

So you have missing <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>.
This could be SMC issue.
Do you get green light on magsafe?
Be sure to use 60/85W original charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, strange voltages on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>
threads.message:
Yes, I have the green led on the charger jack.

I think <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is fine. I measured voltage between pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R7273</RESISTOR> and ground and I get 3.401V. But on pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R7273</RESISTOR> the voltage to ground is 14 mV. I also checked resistance 7273 and I get 43.1kohm, as opposed to 95kohm from a board where <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> is functioning properly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, strange voltages on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>
